title: Your Truth is BS - Part 2
itunes:title: Your Truth is BS - Part 2
itunes:subtitle: You'd be shocked if you knew how quickly "being authentic" can become "being an @$$hole," but here's the good news: it's not too late to stop doing that sh*t!
description:
In the eye-opening conclusion to last week's conversation about authenticity and speaking your truth - Gary's taking the nation straight to the heart of how your complaints bastardize the truth and take you from "being authentic" to "being an @$$hole." But that's just the beginning! Gary's going up against a lightning round of questions to show what authenticity is all about before capping things off with one HUGE question from the nation. It's another electrifying episode you won't want to miss, but if you need more reason to tune in right now, here's what Gary's unpacking this week:


  • What personal development practices or ideologies do you consider BS?
  • Are there any other books that you recommend checking out before cracking into Unfu*k Yourself, Stop Doing that Sh*t, or Wise as Fu*k?
  • Where are you finding hope during these challenging times?
  • What's the line that separates living as your authentic self from egotistical living? 


All that and more on this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!


Are You Ready to Unfu*k Yourself for Good?

  1. If you want to be the first to know when we drop new episodes, please take a moment to Follow or Subscribe to Unfuck Nation wherever you listen to your favorite Podcasts.
  2. If you have a question for Gary that you'd like featured on an upcoming episode, you can click here to email him directly or leave us a voicemail on the Unfuck Nation Hotline at (646) 450-3203.
  3. If you'd like to show your support for the show, we would greatly appreciate it if you would share the show with a friend or write a review for the show on Apple Podcasts.
  4. For more of Gary's content, you can click here to visit his website or you can connect with him on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.
